function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Medium contact intensity in grocery stores and restaurants","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Online communities and services in gymnasiums","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High contact services operating during a total lockdown","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Development of online communities for hair salons","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Small family-run businesses without resources to develop online presence","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High degree of physical interaction required for service delivery","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of defined laws and regulations surrounding the spread of covid-19","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges in transitioning services online","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close physical interaction between service providers and customers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High degree of interactivity in service delivery","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Online service delivery with no physical interaction","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proactive signals are costly, leading some firms to choose not to adopt an accommodative posture.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inertial pressures to conform to laws, regulations, and decrees imposed by local and state governments.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Deliberate communication strategies using accommodative signals are necessary, even if costly.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Firms resisting the use of accommodative signals in communication","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Social construction of hurricanes as acts of nature may limit proactive disease mitigation efforts","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Information asymmetry in pandemic situations can hinder effective communication and response","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Surplus information held by some entities during a pandemic may not be effectively shared with others","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Different frames of reference for the cause of the pandemic leading to differential influences on beliefs and attitudes","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Socially constructed contagion frames of reference leading to different meanings and behaviors","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective response to natural disasters due to lack of resilience","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Racial stereotypes perpetuated by covid medical studies influencing brand decisions.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risks of mishandling past depictions of slavery in media and entertainment.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Theorizing and human connectedness in pandemic research impacting societal trust and organizational resilience.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Covid-19 transmission through close contact","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Theorizing and rebranding without successful implementation","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid turnover of untested ideas leading to fads","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagious disease transmission in dense urban areas due to increased customer footfall in pickup locations","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of contagion in restaurants due to high customer turnover and close proximity","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential contamination and transmission of diseases through food delivery and pickup services","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conflicting and minute guidelines from governments and chain owners creating challenges for food restaurant franchisees in implementing covid-19 reopening protocols.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adoption of creative tinkering by firms in various industries due to the constraining nature of regulations.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Proactive adoption of drive-in screening options by cinema theatres in response to covid-19 regulatory constraints.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to social distancing regulations in institutional environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Provision of free masks by hair salons without adherence to health and safety regulations","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Theorizing and significant investment in brand meaning without clear economic justification","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conformity to rules and norms may stifle innovation and growth.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Deviation from the norm and isomorphism may lead to a lack of adaptation to disruptions like pandemics.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of modern institutional theory may hinder firms from achieving social legitimacy and innovation in dealing with disruptions like pandemics.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to crowded indoor environments such as casinos","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Normative pressure leading to potential neglect of health and safety regulations","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mimicking of social norms leading to potential disregard for health and safety measures","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disease transmission in the built environment due to social interactions and legitimacy-seeking activities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Studies under the functionalist school focused on rational efforts of managers to maximize efficiency through the coordination and control of work activities.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift toward studying contingency variables such as environmental uncertainty, and determining their effect on structure.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Bounded rationality studies suggesting that managers are boundedly rational, and decision making entails a satisficing rather than an optimizing approach.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Power dependence theory and institutional theory providing a supplemental and different viewpoint for conceptualizing organizations.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Integration of institutional theory with past pandemics","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on service firms and customer interaction","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Resistance to adopting new practices such as e-consulting for haircuts","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
